title: 110_hr1318
content: The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" is the short title of the Act. It repeals the authority for agent or attorney representation in veterans benefits cases before the Department of Veterans Affairs. The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" repeals the authority for agent or attorney representation in veterans benefits cases before the Department of Veterans Affairs. Title 38, United States Code, is amended to require individuals to show good moral character, competence, and qualification before assisting claimants in presenting claims. The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" amends various sections of Title 38, United States Code, including changes to section 5902(b) and section 5903. It also repeals the modification of the date for commencement of services in section 5904(c), with specific amendments outlined. The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" makes amendments to Title 38, United States Code, including changes to section 5902(b) and section 5903. It repeals the modification of the date for commencement of services in section 5904(c. The Act also includes provisions regarding fees charged for services provided after a certain date. The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" amends Title 38, United States Code by adding provisions related to fee agreements. The Board may review and order a reduction in fees if found excessive. Section 5905 is also amended to address solicitation of fees. The "Veterans' Benefits Protection Act" prohibits charging fees except as provided in specific sections. It also includes conforming repeals to certain sections of the Veterans Benefits, Health Care, and Information Technology Act of 2006.
